seg.seg: (Der König) beschied alle Tī(rthas) zu sich, ... sie sagten dem König die Wahrheit.
(The king) summoned all Tī(rthas) to him, ... they told the truth to the king.
(Der geborene Mensch) wird bestimmt zusammen mit solcher Zungenaxt aus dem Leibe der Mutter geboren. Durch sie zerstückelt er (hier) sich (selbst).
(The human born) is certainly born from [his] mother's body together with such a tongue-axe. With it, he cuts up him(self here).
has gone from the house ... and also [only] to hear the name, [that] he will not obtain [so] soon. [28d]
... sich selbst [und] die Wesen zerschneiden sie.
... themselves [and] the beings they cut up.
In (many) births they see sufferings ... [30d] (Whoever blames? the good one) [and] praises the bad one, that is to be called one who has lost sight, [and]
not soon will there have to be a cure [for him] ... (fallen) he has in any way. Such a being is (re)born in hell.
There are eight cold hells ... are as many. Sesame drop by sesame [drop?] the flesh

of the bickering ones in these hells besprinkles. [31d] Again at another time (the Tīrthas? caused) the girl Cañcā, (to evoke) blame against the Buddha. In a great assembly the one having the (ten) powers proclaimed the good
sweet law. There the beings were listening with [their] whole self. The Kausala-king (came) with his followers ... to (this) place. The girl Cañcā
came. She walking with a log of wood bound to her belly came before the Omniscient. [32d]
